summary: A fiery young man clashes with an unflinching forest officer in a south Indian village where spirituality, fate and folklore rule the lands.

reviews.content: Knowing nothing about India's religion or culture, I'll only talk about the entertaining value of this movie. Only after watching it, I knew the main actor is the writer, and director as well, and I was quite impressed because his performance as actor was trully stunning. This movie is very well done, there's no filler content, it has unexpected turns which got me shocked, and it has some little humor as well. In short, it's intriguing, engaging, and magical. It was a pleasure to watch

After I finished watching this movie I joined my hands and bowed my head to give respect to the people who worked on this movie, especially one and only Rishab Shetty who did a true marvellous work. And thanks that I have come to know about Bhagwan Panjuri 🙏, I will visit the village and the region someday in the near future.

No one can ever beat the acting Rishab Shetty managed to do at the end. Not a single dull moment in the climax. The movie is elevated beyond anything, only through the last 10 minutes of acting. This moment, I may never forget!  I had goosebumps through the climax. I re-watched it a little over 10 times. I recommend it.

So culturally rooted with some fantastic moments and a spellbinding score. Kantara is a true masterpiece from Kannada film industry.

An experience of a movie. It’s unapologetically and fearlessly pure/authentic, despite being relentlessly/severely being persecuted for its existence for millennia to announce to the world “I’m still here.”

What a wonderful acting done by Rishab Shetty! He wrote, directed and played two roles but in none did he fail. Especially the ending! It's mind blowing how he transformed himself the God. Watch it just for the last 20 minutes!
Truly a big screen experience, Folklore, humor - oodles of it and human conflict have been narrated brilliantly backed with amazing lead actors and supporting cast.
It's absolutely one of the finest movies ever made in India and nevertheless the action sequences and that climax
